review: Content is good.  It fits me well as I have a prime account.  It however sporadically fail to work on my TV.  Sometimes once a week, once a day, or once every other show it displays 'HDCP unauthorized. Content Disabled' with a blue screen.  I have to unplug the device and power down and unplug my TV to get it to work again.  On many of the forums Amazon blames the TVs as being to old and incompatible.  I see two problems with this justification - 1. If I had a newer TV it would likely have smart features that would mitigate the need for Amazon TV and 2. I run or have ran an apple tv, a roku 3, WD tv, PS3, various DVD/Blu-ray players, and DVRs for long periods with no problems.Here is my Current Television http://www.amazon.com/Sony-BRAVIA-W-Series-KDL-52W4100-52-Inch/dp/B0017Q8B70/ref=cm_cr_pr_product_top?ie=UTF8

review: I have had a few streaming devices in the past, the apple TV being by far my favorite. But I really wanted something I could watch all of my amazon content with. I got this and was actually surprised by how many features it had and the overall easy use of the program and tools. The remote has a clean, streamlined design that makes it very intuitive to use. I'm only giving it 4 stars because I was a little disappointed in the quality of the streaming, compared to other similar devices. Initially when it loads a movie or a tv show it seems to have a hard time. Everything is a bit pixelated and fuzzy for the first two or three minutes, but eventually it synchs up and looks nice and crisp. All in all, it's pretty good. I'm really happy to be able to just plug this thing in and be able to watch my Prime videos!
